balancePaymentRatio.title: balance to minimum payment ratio
balancePaymentRatio.description: Attempts to find debts that will be easy to pay off and add quickly to your snowball.
balancePaymentRatio.explanation: Snowballing your debts to pay off the lowest balance to minimimum payment first will spend {{amount}} less in interest.
balancePaymentRatio.evaluation: This is a preferred strategy as it can be mentally and emotionally easier than the Highest Interest Rate strategy and usually quicker than the Lowest Balance strategy.

balanceRateRatio.title: balance to interest rate ratio
balanceRateRatio.description: Attempts to find debts that will be easy to pay off and add quickly to your snowball.
balanceRateRatio.explanation: Snowballing your debts to pay off the lowest balance to interest rate first will spend {{amount}} less in interest.
balanceRateRatio.evaluation: This is a preferred strategy as if can be mentally and emotionally easier than the Highest Interest Rate strategy and quicker than the Lowest Balance strategy.

highestBalance.title: highest balance first
highestBalance.description: Pay off the highest balance first.
highestBalance.explanation: Snowballing your debts to pay off the highest balance first will spend {{amount}} less in interest.
highestBalance.evaluation: This is calculated as a counter-point to the Lowest Balance strategy to show how much of a difference the order of repayment makes.

highestRate.title: highest interest first
highestRate.description: By paying off the loans with the highest interest rate first you end up paying less in interest in total.
highestRate.explanation: Snowballing your debts to pay off the highest interest first will spend {{amount}} less in interest.
highestRate.evaluation: This will save the most money, but may be the most mentally and emotionally challenging to execute since it usually takes longer to feel like it is having any effect.

lowestBalance.title: lowest balance first
lowestBalance.description: By paying off loans with the lowest balance first you can increase your snowball quickly.
lowestBalance.explanation: Snowballing your debts to pay off the lowest balance first will spend {{amount}} less in interest.
lowestBalance.evaluation: This is one of the most commonly promoted strategies and often is easier mentally and emotionally to execute since you are able to build momentum quickly and feel good about the progress you make.

lowestRate.title: lowest interest rate first
lowestRate.description: Pay off the lowest interest rate first.
lowestRate.explanation: Snowballing your debts to pay off the lowest interest rate first will spend {{amount}} less in interest.
lowestRate.evaluation: This is calculated as a counter-point to the Highest Interest Rate strategy to show how much of a difference the order of repayment makes.

minimumPayment.title: minimum payment only
minimumPayment.description: Pay off the minimum payment only.
minimumPayment.explanation: Only paying off the minimum payment required each month.
minimumPayment.evaluation: This is the anti-thesis of paying off your debt fast.

accelerate.description: Add {{extra}} more each month and save an additional {{saved}} in interest.

save.label: Save for later
save.help: Stores the debt and repayment information locally for your next visit.
